q1.question: A DFA can proccess inputs from left to right OR right to left.

q2.question: What state is the given DFA in?

q3.question: DFAs can be used to add more letters to the given input.

q4.question: A DFA can end in different states given the same string as the input.

q5.question: A DFA machine may be a non-deterministic machine.

q6.question: Suppose we have a DFA that tests to see if a string is a valid integer. What will be the result of giving it this input: 23213

q7.question: Suppose we have a DFA that tests to see if a string is a valid Java identifier. Which of the following will be REJECTED by this proposed DFA?

q8.description: $Q$ is a set of all the states of a DFA. Graphically it is all the states/circles.
q8.question: Which of the following represents $Q$?

q9.description: $F$ is a SET of all the final states. Graphically depicated as states with an extra circle around them.
q9.question: Which of the following represents $F$?

q10.description: $\Sigma$ is the set of the input alphabet used for the DFA. Graphically depicated as all the symbols on the transitions lines.
q10.question: Which of the following represents the alphabet set $\Sigma$?

q11.description: $Q_0$ is the start state of a DFA. Graphiccally an arrow/ triangle points to this state.
q11.question: Which of the following represents the start state $Q_0$?

q12.description: $\delta$ is the transtions between the states. Example of a move: $\delta(q0, 1) = q0$
q12.question: What is $\delta$(q0,0)?

q13.description: $\delta$ is the transtions between the states. Example of a move: $\delta(q0, 1) = q0$
q13.question: What is  $\delta$(q1,1)?

q14.description:
$\delta$ is sometimes expressed in tabular format. $\begin{array}{r|cc}
      & 0  & 1 \\
      \hline
      q0 &  &  \\
      q1 &  &  \\
      \end{array}$
q14.question: Which of these is the $\delta$ for the DFA graph?
answer:
\begin{array}{r|cc} & 0 & 1
 \\ \hline q0 & q1 & q0 \\ q1 & q1 & q0 \\ \end{array}
choices:
\begin{array}{r|cc} & 0 & 1 \\ \hline q0 & q0 & q0 \\ 
q1 & q1 & q1 \\ \end{array}

\begin{array}{r|cc} & 0 & 1
 \\ \hline q0 & q1 & q0 \\ q1 & q1 & q0 \\ \end{array}

\begin{array}{r|cc} & 0 & 1 \\ \hline q0 & q0 & q1 \\ q1
 & q0 & q1 \\ \end{array}

q15.question: Which of the following strings will be accepted?

q16.description: When making a transition not shown in the diagram, then the string is not accepted.
q16.question: Which of the following strings will be accepted?

q17.description: A complete DFA has a transition for every alphabet in $\Sigma$ for all states.
q17.question: An incomplete DFA can be made complete by adding a trap state?
